profile.documentation: Actors represent roles within your model. To designate that a role has access to a given web service you must draw a dependency from an Actor to the <<WebService>>.

element.name: SERVICE
element.documentation: (From Java profile) Creates a WSDD file for each model element with this stereotype. Each method to be exposed, must be stereotyped with the <<WebServiceOperation>> stereotype.

element.name: WEBSERVICE
element.documentation: Creates a WSDD service fragment and exposes ALL methods of the element as a web service.

element.name: WEB_SERVICE_OPERATION
element.documentation: This is used in conjunction with the <<Service>> stereotype. Adds the method to the list of allowed methods which will be exposed as a web service. You MUST place this stereotype on an operation if you want it exposed as a web service (unless you add the <<WebService>> stereotype to your class).

element.name: VALUE_OBJECT
element.documentation: (From Java Profile) Allows the definition of complex types. These types can be related to each other through associations and if the association multiplicity is greater than 1, then an array reference will be generated (instead of a Collection), unless using CXF or JAX-WS with useArrayWrapper=false.

element.name: ENUMERATION
element.documentation: (From Java profile) Allows the definition of enumerated types. These types MUST define their attributes as frozen. Deprecated: Use UML Enumerations instead.

element.name: NULLABLE
element.documentation: (From Java profile) Allows you to define whether or not operation parameters can be nullable or nillable (in WSDL terms). If this is NOT defined on a parameter, then a null check will be generated for that parameter on the service operation. Deprecated: Use UML2 multiplicity lowerBound = 0.

element.name: PACKAGE_MAP
element.documentation: (From XML profile) Defines a package which is mapped to a Schema Namespace, so that an .xsd file is created for this package and imported by the wsdl files that reference the schema. Deprecated: Use XMLSchema instead.

element.name: XML_SCHEMA
element.documentation: (From XML profile) Defines a package which is mapped to a Schema Namespace, so that an .xsd file is created for this package and imported by the wsdl files that reference the schema. ValueObjects referenced in the service must be in a package with this Stereotype if importedXSD=true (the default).

element.name: XML_ATTRIBUTE
element.documentation: (From XML profile) Attribute, parameter is rendered as an XML attribute instead of an element. Overrides global default.

element.name: XML_ELEMENT
element.documentation: (From XML profile) Attribute, parameter is rendered as an XML element instead of an attribute. Overrides global default.

element.name: NO_XML
element.documentation: (From XML profile) Do not render class, parameter, property with Xml Jaxb annotations. Overrides global default.

element.name: WEB_SERVICE_FEED
element.documentation: This is used in conjunction with the <<WebService>> stereotype. Annotates CXF REST classes producing Atom feeds with custom feed and entry properties. Adds JAX-RS annotations to the service operation. If not specified, properties must be implemented in WSDelegate implementation class. Feed Properties include author, category, contributor, generator, icon, id, link, logo, rights, source, subtitle, title, updated. Entry Properties include author, category, contributor, id, link, published, rights, summary, title, updated.

element.name: WEB_SERVICE_PARAM
element.documentation: This is used in conjunction with the <<WebServiceOperation>> stereotype with CXF. Additional Detail on WebService parameter, different than defaults, which maps Stereotype attribute values to REST values for the parameter by adding JAX-RS annotations. Attributes include: name, mode, header, partName, encoded, REST_parameter_URL, REST_path_param, REST_param_type, REST_path_segment.

element.name: WEB_FAULT
element.documentation: This is used in conjunction with the <<ValueObject>> and <<ApplicationException>> stereotypes with CXF. Designates an Exception class as a JAX-WS WebFault, which creates a faultBean class referenced by the service containing a fault exception and cause in the same package as the Service, plus the original WebFault exception class. JavaException name is mapped to the webservice fault name in the wsdl definition. WebService Faults must be modeled as a UML operation Exception, referencing a Class with one of the Exception stereotypes. This class must have a single association to a ValueObject that is also labeled with <<WebFault>>. This class contains the additional details returned through the webservice fault.

element.name: WEB_SERVICE_STYLE
element.documentation: Defines the style of the web service to be generated (i.e. wrapped, document, rpc). Default=wrapped.

element.name: WEB_SERVICE_PARAMETER_STYLE
element.documentation: Defines the parameter style of the web service to be generated (i.e. bare, wrapped). Default=wrapped.

element.name: WEB_SERVICE_USE
element.documentation: The use of the service to be generated (i.e. literal, encoded). Default=literal.

element.name: WEB_SERVICE_PROVIDER
element.documentation: The provider to use for the service, by default is RPC which will use a plain java object as the provider. Another value that can be specified is EJB, if this is specified, then its expected that either the EJB or Hibernate cartridge is being used with this cartridge. Use JAX-WS for jaxws or cxf. Can be 'EJB' or 'RPC' or 'JAX-WS'. Default=default. Not applicable for JAX-WS.

element.name: WEB_WSDL_SOAP_ADDRESS
element.documentation: The WSDL SOAP Address to use for the service, by default is $webserviceHost:$webservicePort/$webContext/services

element.name: ROLE_NAME
element.documentation: Optionally allows you to define the name of the role (if it needs to be different than the name of the actor that defines the role).
element.appliedOnElement: An actor with a dependency to a <<WebService>>

element.name: ATTRIBUTE_FORM_DEFAULT
element.documentation: XML attributeFormDefault value for package-info.java on XmlSchema stereotype. XmlNsForm=QUALIFIED, UNQUALIFIED, default=UNQUALIFIED

element.name: ELEMENT_FORM_DEFAULT
element.documentation: XML elementFormDefault value for package-info.java on XmlSchema stereotype. XmlNsForm=QUALIFIED, UNQUALIFIED, default=QUALIFIED

element.name: XML_SCHEMA_VALIDATION
element.documentation: Validate incoming/outgoing XML against the declared schema. Default=false allows minor service revisions to use the same service version when optional attributes are added to the new minor revision. JAX-WS and CXF services only - sets options in Spring ApplicationContext.xml.

element.name: XML_NAMESPACE
element.documentation: XML package namespace, overrides default reversed package name.

element.name: XML_XMLNS
element.documentation: XML package namespace abbreviation, overrides default sequentially numbered nsX. Each must be unique.

element.name: XML_NAME
element.documentation: XML attribute/element name, overrides default attribute/parameter name.

element.name: XML_ADAPTER
element.documentation: Supplies type value for @XmlAdapter Jaxb annotation for attribute or element. Overrides global default for date, time, dateTime, integer XML types

element.name: XML_TRANSIENT
element.documentation: Prevents the mapping of a Java type to XML.

element.name: XML_TYPE
element.documentation: Overrides the default schema type for this property or parameter. i.e. mapping between from UML type to XML

element.name: JAXB_SIMPLE_BINDING_MODE
element.documentation: If Jaxb2 SimpleBindingMode should be used when generating Java objects from the WSDL webservice definition using the wsdl2java utility. Default=true.

element.name: JAXB_XJC_ARGUMENTS
element.documentation: WebService stereotype: Override global default XJC arguments used when creating Jaxb XML bindings from the webservice definition through the wsdl2java utility. Default is -Xcommons-lang,-Xcommons-lang:ToStringStyle=DEFAULT_STYLE,-Xdefault-value,-Xvalue-constructor,-Xcollection-setter-injector,-simple-preserve. This creates toString methods using apache commons-lang, creates ValueObject constructor, get/set on Collection types, and allows preserving methods and some code across multiple code generation invocations. Uses JAXB2 plugin dependencies referenced by BuildWS.xml ant script.

element.name: SERIALVERSIONUID
element.documentation: Adds serialVeraionUID to WebService class

element.name: SERVICE_LOGGING
element.documentation: Log incoming and outgoing XML messages in CXF. Configures Spring logging. default=true, but the Spring Configuration is not overwritten if changed.

element.name: SERVICE_NAME
element.documentation: Customize the @WebService(serviceName) annotation and wsdl bindings. Default empty uses the class name as the service name.

element.name: WSDL_LOCATION
element.documentation: Customize the @WebService(wsdlLocation) annotation and wsdl bindings. Default empty uses the URI at which the service is deployed, so the wsdl is created from the @WebService annotations dynamically.

element.name: WSDL_SOAP_ADDRESS
element.documentation: Overrides the global wsdlSoapAddress setting for this WebService class.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_OPERATION_NAME
element.documentation: CXF and JAX-WS: Customize the exposed service operation name with @WebMethod(operationName). Can prevent conflicts due to overloaded operations, which are not allowed in JAX-WS without annotations and bindings customizations.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST
element.documentation: Implement this class as a CXF REST webservice. This is the only value required to be set, all the other REST options are set to default values unless overridden. All methods on the WebService class will be REST.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST_CONSUMES
element.documentation: Media type consumed by this service.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST_CONTEXTS
element.documentation: Adds @Context annotations to the service. Context(s) are comma or semicolon or pipe delimited, appear on separate lines within the Service class.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST_HTTP_METHOD
element.documentation: Custom Http Method, something other than GET/PUT/POST.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST_PATH
element.documentation: URL path for REST webservice. default=lowercase class name.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST_PRODUCES
element.documentation: Type of service output produced by the service.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST_PROVIDER
element.documentation: Marks service with @Provider annotation, used with @Produces and @Consumes

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST_REQUEST_TYPE
element.documentation: REST Request type (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEADER, OPTIONS).

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST_RETENTION_POLICY
element.documentation: RetentionPolicy. default=RUNTIME.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST_TARGET
element.documentation: ElementType. default=METHOD.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST_ENCODED
element.documentation: Adds @Encoded annotation. default=false (no annotation)

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST_PART_TYPE
element.documentation: Multipart response part type annotation.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST_SUSPEND
element.documentation: Annotates method with @Suspend(interval in ms), used for asynchronous responses and polling. default=0 (do not suspend, do not add annotation).

element.name: WEBSERVICE_REST_ROLES_ALLOWED
element.documentation: Comma separated list of security roles. May include 'all', 'none'.
